summary: The implementation covers most core requirements including frontend components, backend data model, routing, and Netflix-inspired styling. However, several requirements are partially implemented or missing: the backend lacks query methods by category, sample data seeding is incomplete (only 2 movies instead of 20+), responsive design lacks mobile hamburger menu collapse, and navigation scroll behavior is not fully implemented.

missing_requirements.requirement: Horizontal scrollable rows organized by categories (e.g., 'Trending Recaps', 'Action Movies', 'Drama', 'Comedy')
missing_requirements.reason: HomePage.tsx seeds sample movies but does not organize them into category-based rows. All movies are fetched via searchMovies('') but not filtered/grouped by genre for display in separate rows.

missing_requirements.requirement: Query methods to retrieve movies by category
missing_requirements.reason: Backend main.mo lacks a method to retrieve movies filtered by genre/category. Only searchMovies (by title text) and getMovie (by single title) exist.

missing_requirements.requirement: Navigation collapses to hamburger menu on mobile
missing_requirements.reason: Navbar.tsx has a Sheet component for mobile menu, but navigation links are only hidden on desktop (hidden md:flex). The hamburger menu does not actually collapse/replace the center navigation links on mobile as specified.

missing_requirements.requirement: Seed the backend with sample movie data for at least 20 movies across multiple genres
missing_requirements.reason: Backend seedData() in main.mo only includes 2 sample movies (Inception and The Godfather). HomePage.tsx attempts to seed more movies but only adds 3 additional movies, totaling far less than the required 20 movies across 4-5 genres.
